revised_title: A Historical Overview of Specific Gravities and Their Observations
tldr: This article presents a collection of historical specific gravity experiments and observations from various authors. The author, Richard Davies, compiles tables of specific gravities and discusses the methods and limitations of the experiments. The article highlights the contributions of ancient and early modern scientists, such as Archimedes, Vitruvius, and Marinus Ghetaldus, and their impact on the understanding of specific gravities and their applications in natural philosophy and physics.
